page.title: 01The Landscape of Codford
page.content: Ours is a nice area in which to live. There are rolling Downs with the River Wylye running through the valley. The Chitterne Brook flows through the school grounds and enters the River wylye in Codford. There is a main road called the A.36. which splits Codford and spoils it a bit as continuous traffic runs through the village but we hope to have a bye_pass built soon. There are a variety of houses in the area, some very old and some modern. Codford is the largest village with Stockton and Sherrington the next biggest villages being much smaller. Our area is mainly fields and open grazing land with the ancient earthwork of Codford Circle overlooking the village of Codford.
